overview: Gangtok is the bustling, friendly hill‑station capital of Sikkim, known for its clean streets, scenic valleys and views of the Kanchenjunga range. The city blends indigenous Sikkimese, Nepali and Tibetan cultures and offers a mix of monasteries, markets and easy‑going pedestrian streets like MG Marg.
topAttractions: Panoramic views of the Kanchenjunga range
travelTips: Use shared jeeps or fixed‑fare taxis; confirm the fare (e.g., ₹400 from Siliguri, ₹100 private within town) before boarding
Carry small change for entrance fees (e.g., ₹10 for the Tibetology museum) and ropeway tickets (₹80)
Eat at local eateries near MG Marg for inexpensive Sikkimese, Nepali and Bhutanese dishes
Avoid plastic bags and dispose of litter in designated bins as Sikkim enforces strict anti‑littering rules
Stay in Gangtok itself rather than remote areas, especially if traveling alone
Internet connectivity is good; Jio and Airtel provide reliable 4G service
Check Zomato or similar apps for restaurant menus, but note not all venues are listed
